data.chText: 空间
data.enText: empty area

data.chText: （可利用的）空地，空间
data.enText: an amount of an area or of a place that is empty or that is available for use

data.chText: 楼面面积、办公室里的空间、搁架上的空当等
data.enText: floor/office/shelf, etc. space

data.chText: 我们必须充分利用现有空间。
data.enText: We must make good use of the available space.

data.chText: 那张桌子占的地方太大。
data.enText: That desk takes up too much space .

data.chText: 这个部门存放东西的地方很小。
data.enText: There is very little storage space in the department.

data.chText: 我们能不能腾个空再放一把椅子？
data.enText: Can we make space for an extra chair?

data.chText: 这会占用多少磁盘空间？
data.enText: How much disk space will it take up (= on a computer) ?

data.chText: 空；空隙；空子；空当
data.enText: an area or a place that is empty

data.chText: 大 / 小 / 窄 / 宽的空当
data.enText: a large/small/narrow/wide space

data.chText: 长三米宽两米的空间
data.enText: a space two metres by three metres

data.chText: 停车的空地
data.enText: a parking space

data.chText: 一起挤在狭小的空间
data.enText: crowded together in a confined space

data.chText: 我来腾出一块地方好放你的书。
data.enText: I'll clear a space for your books.

data.chText: 桌子和墙中间有个空，把它放那儿去。
data.enText: Put it in the space between the table and the wall.

data.chText: 宽敞；空旷；开阔
data.enText: the quality of being large and empty, allowing you to move freely

data.chText: 这么一装潢，一布置，这间屋子就给人一种宽敞的感觉。
data.enText: The room has been furnished and decorated to give a feeling of space.

data.chText: （无建筑物的）大片空地，开阔地
data.enText: a large area of land that has no buildings on it

data.chText: 加拿大一片片广袤的草原
data.enText: the wide open spaces of the Canadian prairies

data.chText: 这座城市既有漂亮的建筑又有开阔的空地。
data.enText: It's a city with fine buildings and plenty of open space .

data.chText: 地球大气以外
data.enText: outside earth's atmosphere
outer space

data.chText: 外层空间；太空
data.enText: the area outside the earth's atmosphere where all the other planets and stars are

data.chText: 第一位进入太空的女性
data.enText: the first woman in space

data.chText: 出现外层空间来客的可能性
data.enText: the possibility of visitors from outer space

data.chText: 太空飞行；太空飞行任务
data.enText: a space flight/mission

data.chText: 一段时间
data.enText: period of time

data.chText: 一段时间；期间
data.enText: a period of time

data.chText: 五天里死了四十四个人。
data.enText: Forty-four people died in the space of five days.

data.chText: 他们在短时间内取得了很大的成绩。
data.enText: They had achieved a lot in a short space of time .

data.chText: 每次约见要间隔两个星期。
data.enText: Leave a space of two weeks between appointments.

data.chText: 书写；印刷
data.enText: in writing/printing

data.chText: 空白；空行；空格
data.enText: the part of a line, page or document that is empty

data.chText: 页边不要留太宽浪费版面。
data.enText: Don't waste space by leaving a wide margin.

data.chText: 版面有限，无法悉数刊载我们收到的所有来信。
data.enText: There was not enough space to print all the letters we received.

data.chText: 逗号后面要留一个空格。
data.enText: Leave a space after the comma.

data.chText: 自由
data.enText: freedom

data.chText: 自我支配的自由；属于自己的空间
data.enText: the freedom and the time to think or do what you want to

data.chText: 她心境不佳，需要一片自己的天地。
data.enText: She was upset and needed space .

data.chText: 必须给青少年充足的自由空间。
data.enText: You have to give teenagers plenty of space .

data.chText: 空间
data.enText: where things exist/move

data.chText: 空间
data.enText: the whole area in which all things exist and move

data.chText: 很有可能空间和时间是有限的。
data.enText: It is quite possible that space and time are finite.
look/stare/gaze into space

data.chText: 若有所思地望着前方；出神地凝视前方
data.enText: to look straight in front of you without looking at a particular thing, usually because you are thinking about sth
a waste of space

data.chText: 无用的人；干什么都不行的人；废物；饭桶
data.enText: a person who is useless or no good at anything
watch this space

data.chText: （用于命令）等待下面发表的消息
data.enText: used in orders, to tell sb to wait for more news about sth to be announced

data.chText: 目前我不能跟你多说，等着听下面发表的消息吧。
data.enText: I can't tell you any more right now, but watch this space.

data.chText: 以一定间隔排列
data.enText: to arrange things so that they have regular spaces between them

data.chText: 间隔均匀的秧苗
data.enText: evenly spaced plants

data.chText: 一行排列紧密的小点
data.enText: a row of closely spaced dots

data.chText: 这些杆子之间要间隔一米左右。
data.enText: Space the posts about a metre apart.
space out

data.chText: 精神恍惚，神志迷糊（常因吸毒）
data.enText: to take no notice of what is happening around you, especially as a result of taking drugs
space sth↔out

data.chText: 使拉开间距；使隔开
data.enText: to arrange things with a wide space between them

data.chText: 在城市的这一地区，房屋坐落稀疏。
data.enText: The houses are spaced out in this area of town.

data.chText: 以上各词均指作特定用途的土地。
data.enText: These words all mean an area of land that is used for a particular purpose.
land

data.chText: 尤指作特定用途的土地、地带：
data.enText: an area of ground, especially one that is used for a particular purpose

data.chText: 农业用地
data.enText: agricultural land
lot

data.chText: 指作某种用途的一块地、场地：
data.enText: ( NAmE ) a piece of land that is used or intended for a particular purpose

data.chText: 建筑用地
data.enText: building lots

data.chText: 停车场
data.enText: a parking lot
ground

data.chText: 指作特定用途的场地：
data.enText: an area of land that is used for a particular purpose

data.chText: 孩子们在学校附近的荒地玩耍。
data.enText: The kids were playing on waste ground near the school.

data.chText: 古代墓地旧址
data.enText: the site of an ancient burial ground

data.chText: 用land、lot还是ground？
land用以指乡间广阔的土地，尤指农业用地；lot常指城镇或城市中的一小块地，尤指专用的建筑或停车场地；ground作不可数名词指任何开阔地、空旷地，作可数名词指特定用途或活动的场地。
data.enText: Land is used for large areas of open land in the country, especially when it is used for farming. A lot is often a smaller piece of land in a town or city, especially one intended for building or parking on. Ground is any area of open land; a ground is an area of land designed or used for a particular purpose or activity.
land, lot or ground?
space

data.chText: 指无建筑物的大片空地、开阔地：
data.enText: a large area of land that has no buildings on it

data.chText: 这座城市有很多开阔的空地。
data.enText: The city has plenty of open space.

data.chText: 加拿大一片片广袤的草原
data.enText: the wide open spaces of the Canadian prairies
plot

data.chText: 指专用的小块土地：
data.enText: a small piece of land used or intended for a particular purpose

data.chText: 她买了一小块地盖房子。
data.enText: She bought a small plot of land to build a house.

data.chText: 一块菜圃
data.enText: a vegetable plot

data.chText: 用lot还是plot？
lot和plot均可作建筑用地。plot亦可作菜地或墓地。
data.enText: Either a lot or a plot can be used for building on. Only a plot can also be used for growing vegetables or burying people.
lot or plot?
(an) open land/ground/space
(a/an) empty/vacant/unused/derelict land/lot/ground/plot
waste land/ground
a burial plot
look/stare/gaze into space

data.chText: 若有所思地望着前方；出神地凝视前方
data.enText: to look straight in front of you without looking at a particular thing, usually because you are thinking about sth
a waste of space

data.chText: 无用的人；干什么都不行的人；废物；饭桶
data.enText: a person who is useless or no good at anything
watch this space

data.chText: （用于命令）等待下面发表的消息
data.enText: used in orders, to tell sb to wait for more news about sth to be announced

data.chText: 目前我不能跟你多说，等着听下面发表的消息吧。
data.enText: I can't tell you any more right now, but watch this space.
space out

data.chText: 精神恍惚，神志迷糊（常因吸毒）
data.enText: to take no notice of what is happening around you, especially as a result of taking drugs
space sth↔out

data.chText: 使拉开间距；使隔开
data.enText: to arrange things with a wide space between them

data.chText: 在城市的这一地区，房屋坐落稀疏。
data.enText: The houses are spaced out in this area of town.

tr: the unlimited expanse in which everything is located
example: they tested his ability to locate objects in space
the boundless regions of the infinite

tr: (printing) a block of type without a raised letter
used for spacing between words or sentences

example: write your name in the space provided

tr: a blank character used to separate successive words in writing or printing
example: he said the space is the most important character in the alphabet

tr: one of the areas between or below or above the lines of a musical staff
example: the spaces are the notes F-A-C-E

tr: any location outside the Earth's atmosphere
example: the astronauts walked in outer space without a tether
the first major milestone in space exploration was in 1957, when the USSR's Sputnik 1 orbited the Earth

tr: an area reserved for some particular purpose
an empty area (usually bounded in some way between things)
example: the architect left space in front of the building
they stopped at an open space in the jungle
the distance from birth to death
it all happened in the space of 10 minutes
Space the interviews so that you have some time between the different candidates

value.def: You use space to refer to an area that is empty or available. The area can be any size. For example, you can refer to a large area outside as a large open space or to a small area between two objects as a small space .

example.ex: Under the plan, bits of open space — fields, golf-course borders and small parks — will be preserved.
example.tran: 在这份规划里，一些开放空间——运动场、高尔夫球场边缘以及小公园——将得以保留。

example.ex: ...cutting down yet more trees to make space for houses...
example.tran: 砍掉更多的树，腾出空间来盖房子

example.ex: I had plenty of space to write and sew...
example.tran: 我有足够的空间进行写作和缝纫。

example.ex: The space underneath could be used as a storage area...
example.tran: 底下的空间可用作储藏区。

example.ex: He looked cautiously through a half-inch space between the curtains and saw an empty bedroom...
example.tran: 他小心翼翼地透过窗帘上的一条半英寸的缝隙望去，看见了一个空荡荡的卧室。

example.ex: The bird was enclosed in such a small space that it could not turn without bending its tail...
example.tran: 小鸟被关在这么狭小的空间里，不弯一下尾巴的话，都转不过身来。

example.ex: List in the spaces below the specific changes you have made.
example.tran: 在下面空白处列出你所作的具体改动。

value.boxu_tran: space 或 room 可以指一片开阔的区域或一片空地，place 不能作为不可数名词用于该义项。room 多指封闭的空间，例如：There's not enough room in the bathroom for both of us (浴室里容不下我们两个人)，Leave plenty of space between you and the car in front (和前面的汽车保持足够的距离)。
value.boxu_usage: You should use space or room to refer to an open or empty area. You do not use place as an uncount noun in this sense. Room is more likely to be used when you are talking about space inside an enclosed area. There's not enough room in the bathroom for both of us... Leave plenty of space between you and the car in front.

value.def: A particular kind of space is the area that is available for a particular activity or for putting a particular kind of thing in.

example.ex: ...the high cost of office space...
example.tran: 办公场所的高额成本

example.ex: You don't want your living space to look like a bedroom...
example.tran: 你可不希望自己居住的地方看上去像个卧室。

example.ex: Finding a parking space in the summer months is still a virtual impossibility...
example.tran: 在夏季，几乎还是不可能找到一个停车位。

example.ex: The Women's Gym is a women-only space dedicated to women of all ages, shapes and sizes.
example.tran: 女子健身馆对各种年龄层次、体型和个头的女性开放。

value.tran: (活动或储藏用的)空间，场所，面积

value.def: If a place gives a feeling of space, it gives an impression of being large and open.

example.ex: Large paintings can enhance the feeling of space in small rooms...
example.tran: 大型油画可以增加小房间的宽敞感。

example.ex: The sense of space and emptiness is overwhelming.
example.tran: 巨大的空虚感汹涌袭来。

value.def: If you give someone space to think about something or to develop as a person, you allow them the time and freedom to do this.

example.ex: You need space to think everything over...
example.tran: 你需要时间把一切好好地考虑清楚。

example.ex: We will give each other space to develop.
example.tran: 我们会给彼此留出发展的空间。

value.tran: (思考问题、个人成长所需的)时间，余地，空间

value.def: The amount of space for a topic to be discussed in a document is the number of pages available to discuss the topic.

example.ex: We can't promise to publish a reply as space is limited.
example.tran: 由于版面有限，我们不能保证把回复登载出来。

example.ex: ...some work which we couldn't include because of lack of space in this issue.
example.tran: 由于这期篇幅有限，我们无法收纳进来的一些文章

value.tran: (文件中用于讨论某个话题的)版面，篇幅

value.def: A space of time is a period of time.

example.ex: They've come a long way in a short space of time...
example.tran: 他们在很短的时间之内就大老远地赶了过来。

example.ex: I have known dramatic changes occur in the space of a few minutes with this method.
example.tran: 我知道用这种方法短短几分钟之内就能够产生急剧的变化。

value.def: Space is the area beyond the Earth's atmosphere, where the stars and planets are.

example.ex: The six astronauts on board will spend ten days in space.
example.tran: 飞船上的6名宇航员将在太空度过 10 天。

example.ex: ...launching satellites into space.
example.tran: 发射人造卫星进入外层空间

example.ex: ...developments in space technology.
example.tran: 太空技术的发展

example.ex: ...outer space.
example.tran: 外层空间

value.def: Space is the whole area within which everything exists.

example.ex: She felt herself transcending time and space...
example.tran: 她感到自己正在穿越时空。

example.ex: The physical universe is finite in space and time.
example.tran: 物质世界在时间和空间上是有限的。

value.def: If you space a series of things, you arrange them so that they are not all together but have gaps or intervals of time between them.

example.ex: Women once again are having fewer children and spacing them further apart...
example.tran: 女人再次减少了生孩子的数量，而且生育之间相隔的时间也更长了。

example.ex: His voice was angry and he spaced the words for emphasis.
example.tran: 他的声音里透着愤怒，为了强调，他一字一顿。

example.ex: He talks quite slowly and spaces his words out...
example.tran: 他说得很慢，每个词之间都有停顿。

example.ex: I was spacing out the seedlings into divided trays...
example.tran: 我正在把那些小嫩苗分装进有分格的盘子里。

example.ex: They will have time to draw breath between matches, with their last four fixtures spaced out over three weeks.
example.tran: 由于最后的 4 场比赛间隔分布在 3 个星期里，因此他们有时间在比赛的间隙稍作休息。

example.ex: Its houses are large, well-spaced and surrounded by gardens...
example.tran: 其房子很大、间距适当，周围全是花园。

example.ex: The RAC is calling for rest areas spaced at regular intervals on major roads.
example.tran: 皇家汽车俱乐部呼吁：交通主干道上的休息区应均匀分布。

example.ex: Generous spacing gives healthier trees and better crops.
example.tran: 足够大的间距能使树木和庄稼长得更茁壮。

value.def: If you are staring into space, you are looking straight in front of you, without actually looking at anything in particular, for example because you are thinking or because you are feeling shocked.

example.ex: He just sat in the dressing-room staring into space...
example.tran: 他直愣愣地坐在化妆间里。

example.ex: Molly turned away and gazed off into space, a faraway look in her eyes.
example.tran: 莫莉转过脸去茫然瞪视，眼神似已飘到了远方。

value.def: If you describe someone or something as a waste of space, you are indicating that you have a very low opinion of them.

example.ex: Even Sarah treated him as if he were a waste of space...
example.tran: 连萨拉对他都像是在对待一个废物。

example.ex: Are we expected to believe those scribblings are art? This piece of trash was a waste of space.
example.tran: 我们难道真要把那些乱涂乱画当作艺术吗？这种垃圾留着都占地方。

value.def: Journalists write 'Watch this space' in order to indicate in an informal way that they will be giving more information about something in the future.

example.ex: Watch this space for details of our next event.
example.tran: 请继续关注我们对下一事件的详细报道。

value.tran: (新闻记者将进行后续报道时所说的话)请继续关注

trans: 时间和空间；时间与空间；时空；时空观；表时间和空间
生存空间；（房屋的）可居住面积
间距；间隔空间；区隔空间；两极空间；意愿塌缩区隔空间
空间站；太空站；航天站；宇宙空间站
公共场所，公共空间；银行营业厅
存储空间；储存空间管理；储存空间；储物空间；存储容量
状态空间；国家空间；状态空间法；状态空间模型；状态矢量空间
空间环境；宇宙环境；太空环境；宇宙環境
磁盘空间；空间大小；硬盘空间；磁碟空間；硬碟空间
